configstring.name: path
configstring.desc: Enter the location of the aspell binary

configstring.name: gnupg
configstring.desc: If you want users to have the option of using the GNU Privacy Guard program to decrypt/encrypt PGP files, enter the location of the 'gpg' binary here. If this is empty this feature will be disabled.

configmultienum.name: gnupg_keyserver
configmultienum.desc: The address of the public PGP keyserver(s) to use.

configinteger.name: gnupg_timeout
configinteger.desc: The timeout for connecting to the PGP keyserver. Timeouts are not supported on all systems.

configstring.name: openssl_cafile
configstring.desc: The location of the root certificates bundle, e.g. /etc/ssl/certs. See http://www.php.net/manual/en/ref.openssl.php#openssl.cert.verification for details.

configstring.name: openssl_binary
configstring.desc: The location of the OpenSSL binary on your system, e.g. /usr/bin/openssl. This program is REQUIRED to import personal S/MIME certificate information, as there is no native PHP function that can read pkcs12 files.

configmultienum.name: apps
configmultienum.desc: Select any applications that should be linked in IMP's menu

configswitch.name: allow_folders
configswitch.desc: Should we allow users to use folders at all? NOTE: setting this to false will mean there is no place to save sent-mail or postponed messages, along with the obvious effects of restricting the user to their INBOX.

configboolean.name: allow_resume_all
configboolean.desc: If this is true, the user will be able to resume any message in any mailbox. Otherwise, only messages marked as 'drafts' can be resumed.

configboolean.name: allow_view_source
configboolean.desc: If this is true, then there will be a 'Message Source' link in the parts list of every message, allowing the user to view the entire raw message, or to download it and save it to disk.

configstring.name: alternate_login
configstring.desc: If this is not false, it is assumed to be the URL of an alternate login screen which will be used in place of IMP's default one. If all you need is a message-of-the-day section on the normal login screen, you can set one in imp/config/motd.php. This setting will be ignored if an alternate login screen is configured for horde.

configstring.name: redirect_on_logout
configstring.desc: If this is not false, it is assumed to be the URL of an alternate logout page which users will be sent to when they log out. This setting will be ignored if an alternate logout page is configured for horde

configswitch.name: select_view
configswitch.desc: If either DIMP or MIMP is available, allow user to select the application view on login?

configswitch.name: server_list
configswitch.desc: Should we display a list of servers (defined in config/servers.php) for users to choose from? The options are 'shown', 'hidden', and 'none'. If the server list is hidden then you can use the 'preferred' mechanism to auto-select from it based on an HTTP virtualhost or another piece of data. If it is shown, the user will be able to pick from any of the options. If none, no server list will be shown and the defaults will be used unless another mechanism changes them.

configlist.name: fixed_folders
configlist.desc: A comma separated list of folders that can't be modified (deleted, renamed, etc) by the user, e.g.: "Drafts, Trash". (The mailbox value must be encoded in the UTF7-IMAP charset; see RFC 3501 [5.1.3])

configinteger.name: sort_limit
configinteger.desc: On slower mailservers, sorting by any field other than the arrival of the message may result in very slow performance. This value, if greater than 0 is the number of messages that must be present in a mailbox before the default sort is replaced by the much faster arrival time sort.

configboolean.name: cache_folders
configboolean.desc: If using IMAP, should we cache the list of folders so that the list does not need to be rebuilt on every page load? If set to true, note that any folders created on the server during an IMP session that are NOT created via IMP will not be displayed until the next login. If IMP will be the exclusive means of accessing the mail server, or you are not concerned about this behavior, this setting should be set to true.

configinteger.name: token_lifetime
configinteger.desc: This is the length of time in seconds that links protected with request tokens (to prevent cross-site request forgery) will be valid. Higher values may make your users more vulnerable to these attacks.

configswitch.name: cachejs
configswitch.desc: Cache static javascript and combine into a single page for delivery to the remote browser?

configswitch.name: cachecss
configswitch.desc: Cache static CSS and combine into a single page for delivery to the remote browser?

configboolean.name: show_preview
configboolean.desc: Should we allow users to display message previews in the mailbox index? This is disabled by default as it can be performance intensive, especially without mailbox caching. Note that this option only determines whether or not users are allowed to show previews - each user can still turn previews on or off in their preferences.

configboolean.name: show_account_colors
configboolean.desc: Should we display colors for messages fetched from other accounts in the mailbox index? This is a performance hit unless mailbox caching is enabled.

configinteger.name: size_limit
configinteger.desc: What is the maximum total size of mails to be fetched (in bytes)? (Remember you need more than the double of this value for 'memory_limit' in php.ini.) Set this value to 0 for no limit.

configstring.name: words
configstring.desc: If filtering of message content is turned on, where should we find the list of words to filter out?

configstring.name: replacement
configstring.desc: What should we replace filtered words with?

configswitch.name: reporting
configswitch.desc: Should we display a 'report this message as spam' link?

configswitch.name: reporting
configswitch.desc: Should we display a 'report this message as innocent' link?

configboolean.name: add_printedby
configboolean.desc: Should we add a "Printed By" header to the top of all printed messages?

configboolean.name: prepend_header
configboolean.desc: Should we include the contents of imp/config/header.php in the headers of every message sent?

configboolean.name: append_trailer
configboolean.desc: Should we append the contents of imp/config/trailer.txt to the end of every message sent?

configboolean.name: allow_receipts
configboolean.desc: Can the user request a return receipt?

configboolean.name: use_vfs
configboolean.desc: Should we use the Horde VFS system for storing uploaded attachments?

configswitch.name: link_attachments
configswitch.desc: Should we allow the users to send attachments as links?

configinteger.name: attach_size_limit
configinteger.desc: What is the maximum total size of attachments per message (in bytes)? Set this value to 0 for no limit. [Note, the maximum allowable size of any individual attachment is set via the PHP 'upload_max_filesize' parameter - see imp/docs/INSTALL]

configinteger.name: attach_count_limit
configinteger.desc: What is the maximum total number of attachments per message? Set this value to 0 for no limit.

configinteger.name: reply_limit
configinteger.desc: What is the maximum total size of text (in bytes) to use when replying or forwarding a message. Set this value to 0 for no limit.

configinteger.name: ac_browser
configinteger.desc: For autocompletion of addresses, if the addressbook is below this many entries, the user's address book will be transmitted to the browser if it is below this many entries. This will result in faster lookups and less server load, but requires additional processing on compose creation. Set to 0 to disable.

configinteger.name: ac_threshold
configinteger.desc: When autocompleting addresses in the compose screen, this is the minimum number of characters required before the search is performed on the server.

configboolean.name: vinfo
configboolean.desc: Should we use a custom virtual users hook? If so, make sure you define _imp_hook_vinfo() in hooks.php. The hook will be used to set $_SESSION['imp']['user'] at login time. There are examples in hooks.php.dist.

configboolean.name: postlogin
configboolean.desc: Should we run a custom function post-login? If so, make sure you define _imp_hook_postlogin() in hooks.php. The hook can be used to do anything after the session is established but before we redirect to the initial login page. There are examples in hooks.php.dist.

configboolean.name: postsent
configboolean.desc: Should we run a custom function after sending a message? If so, make sure you define _imp_hook_postsent() in hooks.php. The hook will be used to do anything after a message has been sent successfully and all regular post-sending processing has been done. There is an example in hooks.php.dist.

configboolean.name: signature
configboolean.desc: Should we use a custom signature hook? If so, make sure you define _imp_hook_signature() in hooks.php. The hook will be used to set $_SESSION['imp']['user'] when composing a message. There is an example in hooks.php.dist.

configboolean.name: trailer
configboolean.desc: Should we use a custom function to set the trailer text (if trailer text is appended to outgoing messages)? If so, make sure you define _imp_hook_trailer() in hooks.php. The function will be used to modify the trailer at runtime. There are examples in hooks.php.dist.

configboolean.name: fetchmail_filter
configboolean.desc: Should we use a custom function to filter mail retrieved with the Accounts/Fetchmail icon? If so, make sure you define _imp_hook_fetchmail_filter() in hooks.php. The function is used to filter mail for spam, viruses, or whatever else you set up in the function.

configboolean.name: mbox_redirect
configboolean.desc: Should we use a custom function to dynamically redirect the user based on what mailbox is opened? If so, make sure you define _imp_hook_mbox_redirect() in hooks.php.

configboolean.name: mbox_icon
configboolean.desc: Should we use a custom function to dynamically determine the icons shown for standard folders on the folder page? If so, make sure you define _imp_hook_mbox_icons() in hooks.php.

configboolean.name: mailboxarray
configboolean.desc: Should we run a custom function in which array elements can be added to use in the template file, while processing the message lists? If so, make sure you define _imp_hook_mailboxarray() in config/hooks.php.

configboolean.name: mbox_readonly
configboolean.desc: Should we use a custom function to dynamically determine whether a given folder is read-only? If so, make sure you define _imp_hook_mbox_readonly() in hooks.php.

configboolean.name: disable_compose
configboolean.desc: Should we use a custom function to dynamically determine whether message composition is disabled? If so, make sure you define _imp_hook_disable_compose() in hooks.php.

configboolean.name: spam_email
configboolean.desc: Should we use a custom function to dynamically generate the email address to send spam reporting emails to? If so, make sure you define _imp_hook_spam_email() in hooks.php.

configboolean.name: msglist_flags
configboolean.desc: Should we use a custom function to provide additional flags to messages in the mailbox message list? If so, make sure you define _imp_hook_msglist_flags() in hooks.php.

configboolean.name: display_folder
configboolean.desc: Should we use a custom function to dynamically determine if we show a specified IMAP mailbox in the folderlist ? If so, make sure you define _imp_hook_display_folder() in hooks.php.

configboolean.name: use_maillog
configboolean.desc: By default, IMP will keep track of both who a message was sent to and the date it was sent when forwarding, replying, or redirecting a message. This information is stored using the History class provided by Horde. These entries are deleted when the mail is deleted using IMP in an attempt to keep the number of entries to the minimum required - if not deleted the maillog entry will persist forever.

configswitch.name: driver
configswitch.desc: IMP can log all attempts to send messages including who has sent, when, to which recipients. This information might be used to configure message limits or create favourite recipients lists. Enable this feature only if it doesn't violate privacy rules or laws in your country. What storage driver should we use?

configboolean.name: use_tasklist
configboolean.desc: If Nag is installed on the local system, IMP can allow users to add the details of mail messages to a new task. If you do not want this functionality enabled (it will add to server load because the list of available task categories must be generated on every page load), you should disable this checkbox.

configboolean.name: use_notepad
configboolean.desc: If Mnemo is installed on the local system, IMP can allow users to add the details of mail messages to a new note. If you do not want this functionality enabled (it will add to server load because the list of available note categories must be generated on every page load), you should disable this checkbox.

configstring.name: file
configstring.desc: If you want to require users to accept certain terms before they can use the system, enter the name of the agreement file to display here. Also, make sure to activate the preference in prefs.php (set the value of 'tos_agreement' to 1).

configinteger.name: max_from_chars
configinteger.desc: In the mailbox view, how many characters of From: addresses should we show before truncating them?

configinteger.name: max_subj_chars
configinteger.desc: In the mailbox view, how many characters of Subject: lines should we show before truncating them?

configboolean.name: previewview
configboolean.desc: Should we run a custom function in which array elements can be modified, and javascript code be provided to dynamically update page elements in the preview pane? If so, make sure you define _imp_hook_dimp_previewview() in config/hooks.php. The sample documentation in that file can better explain what can be accomplished with this hook.

configboolean.name: messageview
configboolean.desc: Should we run a custom function in which array elements can be added to use in the template file, while displaying the message text? If so, make sure you define _imp_hook_dimp_messageview() in config/hooks.php. The elements will be available as template tags in the imp/templates/chunks/message.php template file.

configboolean.name: addressformatting
configboolean.desc: Should we run a custom function that is used to format email addresses in message headers? If so, make sure you define _imp_hook_dimp_addressformatting() in config/hooks.php.

configlist.name: css_files
configlist.desc: A list of additional CSS files to load from the imp/themes/ directory.

configboolean.name: debug
configboolean.desc: Turn on javascript debugging? Will cause popup alert windows to appear on various errors. This should be turned off for all production servers.

configinteger.name: buffer_pages
configinteger.desc: The number of viewable pages to send to the browser per server access when listing messages.

configinteger.name: limit_factor
configinteger.desc: When browsing through a message list, if a user comes within this percentage of the end of the current cached viewport, the browser will send a background request to the server to retrieve the next slice of the message list.

configinteger.name: viewport_wait
configinteger.desc: How long, in seconds, to wait before displaying an informational message to users that the message list is still being built. Set to 0 to disable messages.

configboolean.name: background_inbox
configboolean.desc: On initial login to the portal page, load the INBOX in the background?

configmultienum.name: apps
configmultienum.desc: Select any applications that should be linked in DIMP's menu
